verses.roman:
tṛtīyāṁ vaḍavām eke
tāsāṁ saṁjñā-sutās trayaḥ
yamo yamī śrāddhadevaś
chāyāyāś ca sutāñ chṛṇu

synonyms: tṛtīyām—the third wife; vaḍavām—Vaḍavā; eke—some people; tāsām—of all three wives; saṁjñā-sutāḥ trayaḥ—three issues of Saṁjñā; yamaḥ—one son named Yama; yamī—Yamī, a daughter; śrāddhadevaḥ—Śrāddhadeva, another son; chāyāyāḥ—of Chāyā; ca—and; sutān—the sons; śṛṇu—just hear about.
translation: It is said that the sun-god had a third wife, named Vaḍavā. Of the three wives, the wife named Saṁjñā had three children-Yama, Yamī and Śrāddhadeva. Now let me describe the children of Chāyā.
